intro: Oenothera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its leaves vary in shape depending on environmental conditions, a trait that gives it its scientific name. Oenothera heterophylla is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its adaptability to different habitats.
